Class Features

Magical Tinkering

At 1st level, you learn how to invest a spark of magic into mundane objects. Whenever you finish a long rest, you can touch one nonmagical object and imbue it with one of the following effects: light, recorded message, odor, or nonverbal sound. The chosen property lasts indefinitely.

Spellcasting

You study the workings of magic and how to channel it through objects. You have a limited spellcasting ability. Intelligence is your spellcasting ability.

Infuse Item

At 2nd level, you gain the ability to imbue mundane items with magical infusions. You learn four infusions of your choice. Whenever you gain a level, you can replace one infusion you know with a new one. You can infuse two items, increasing at higher levels.

Artisan Specialty

At 3rd level, choose your specialty: Alchemist or Battle Smith. Your specialty grants features at 3rd, 5th, 9th, and 15th level.

The Right Tool for the Job

At 3rd level, you can produce any artisan's tools with 1 hour of work (returns to raw materials after use).

Tool Expertise

At 6th level, your proficiency bonus is doubled for any ability check you make that uses your proficiency with a tool.

Magic Item Adept

At 10th level, you can attune to up to four magic items at once, and crafting magic items takes you a quarter of the normal time.

Magic Item Savant

At 14th level, you can attune to up to five magic items at once, and you ignore all class, race, and level requirements on attuning to or using a magic item.

Soul of Artifice

At 20th level, your understanding of magic items is unmatched. You gain a +1 bonus to all saving throws per magic item you are currently attuned to, and if you're reduced to 0 hit points but not killed outright, you can use your reaction to end one of your infusions, dropping to 1 hit point instead.

Artisan Specialties

Alchemist

"Through chemistry, I remake the world."

Alchemists create potions, elixirs, and experimental substances, blending science and magic.

Tool Proficiency

At 3rd level, you gain proficiency with alchemist's supplies. If you already have this proficiency, you gain proficiency with one other type of artisan's tools.

Alchemist Spells

Starting at 3rd level, you always have certain spells prepared: healing word, ray of sickness (3rd); flaming sphere, melf's acid arrow (5th); gaseous form, mass healing word (9th); blight, death ward (13th); cloudkill, raise dead (17th).

Experimental Elixir

At 3rd level, whenever you finish a long rest, you can magically produce an experimental elixir in an empty flask. Roll on a table to determine the elixir's effect. As an action, a creature can drink the elixir or administer it to another creature. Creating an additional elixir requires expending a spell slot of 1st level or higher.

Alchemical Savant

At 5th level, whenever you cast a spell using alchemist's supplies as the spellcasting focus, you gain a bonus to one roll of the spell equal to your Intelligence modifier.

Restorative Reagents

At 9th level, you can cast *lesser restoration* using alchemist's supplies without expending a spell slot, and you can administer an experimental elixir as a bonus action.

Chemical Mastery

At 15th level, you gain resistance to acid and poison damage and immunity to the poisoned condition. You can cast *greater restoration* and *heal* without expending a spell slot, each once per long rest.

Battle Smith

"I forge both weapons and warriors."

Battle Smiths create weapons, armor, and mechanical defenders.

Tool Proficiency

At 3rd level, you gain proficiency with smith's tools.

Battle Ready

At 3rd level, you gain proficiency with martial weapons and can use Intelligence instead of Strength or Dexterity for attack and damage rolls with magic weapons.

Steel Defender

At 3rd level, you learn to create a Steel Defender, a mechanical construct. It obeys your commands and shares your initiative in combat.

Extra Attack

At 5th level, you can attack twice whenever you take the Attack action.

Arcane Jolt

At 9th level, when you or your defender hits a target with a magic weapon attack, you can channel magical energy to deal an extra 2d6 force damage or restore 2d6 hit points to a creature within 30 feet. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Intelligence modifier.

Improved Defender

At 15th level, your Steel Defender's attacks are magical and deal an extra 1d8 force damage.

Multiclassing

To qualify for a new class, you must have an Intelligence score of 13 or higher. If Artisan isn't your initial class, you gain proficiency with light armor and one type of artisan's tools.

Related Pages

  • Tiktoks - Clockwork creations
  • Shiz University - Research opportunities

character/classes/the-traveler.title: The Traveler
character/classes/the-traveler.content:
The Traveler

"The wild places remember what civilization forgets."

Travelers are wanderers, scouts, and wilderness survivors who know the secret paths through the Vinkus steppes, the hidden routes across the Deadly Desert, and the safe ways through the Great Gillikin forests. They guide refugees, track fugitives, hunt for survival, and maintain connections to the land that urban Ozians have lost. In a nation crossed by borders and surveillance, Travelers know how to move unseen.

Guides and Guardians

Some Travelers work for the government as scouts and trackers. Others guide escapees along the Animal Underground Railroad. All possess deep knowledge of Oz's wild places and the creatures—both Animal and beast—that dwell there.

Class Features

Hit Points

  • Hit Dice: 1d10 per Traveler level
  • Hit Points at 1st Level: 10 + your Constitution modifier
  • Hit Points at Higher Levels: 1d10 (or 6) + your Constitution modifier per Traveler level after 1st

Proficiencies

  • Armor: Light armor, medium armor, shields
  • Weapons: Simple weapons, martial weapons
  • Tools: None
  • Saving Throws: Strength, Dexterity
  • Skills: Choose three from Animal Handling, Athletics, Insight, Investigation, Nature, Perception, Stealth, Survival

Equipment

  • (a) scale mail or (b) leather armor
  • (a) two shortswords or (b) two simple melee weapons
  • (a) a dungeoneer's pack or (b) an explorer's pack
  • A longbow and a quiver of 20 arrows

The Traveler Table

Class Features

Favored Enemy

At 1st level, choose a type of favored enemy: beasts, fey, humanoids, or monstrosities. You have advantage on Survival checks to track your favored enemies and on Intelligence checks to recall information about them. You learn one language spoken by your favored enemies.

You choose one additional favored enemy at 6th and 14th level.

Natural Explorer

You are a master of navigating the natural world. Choose one type of favored terrain: arctic, coast, desert, forest, grassland, mountain, or swamp. When you make an Intelligence or Wisdom check related to your favored terrain, your proficiency bonus is doubled. While traveling for an hour or more in your favored terrain, you gain several benefits including difficult terrain doesn't slow your group's travel, your group can't become lost, you remain alert to danger even when engaged in other activities, you can move stealthily at a normal pace when traveling alone, and you find twice as much food and water when you forage.

You choose additional favored terrain types at 6th and 10th level.

Fighting Style

At 2nd level, choose a fighting style: Archery, Defense, Dueling, or Two-Weapon Fighting.

Spellcasting

Starting at 2nd level, you learn ranger spells. Wisdom is your spellcasting ability.

Traveler Archetype

At 3rd level, choose your archetype: Hunter or Beastmaster. Your choice grants features at 3rd, 7th, 11th, and 15th level.

Primeval Awareness

At 3rd level, you can use your action and expend one spell slot to focus your awareness on the region around you. For 1 minute per level of the spell slot you expend, you can sense whether certain types of creatures are present within 1 mile of you (or within up to 6 miles if you are in your favored terrain).

Extra Attack

Beginning at 5th level, you can attack twice whenever you take the Attack action.

Land's Stride

Starting at 8th level, moving through nonmagical difficult terrain costs you no extra movement. You can also pass through nonmagical plants without being slowed and without taking damage from thorns, spines, and similar hazards.

Hide in Plain Sight

At 10th level, you can spend 1 minute creating camouflage for yourself. Once camouflaged, you can hide against a solid surface and gain a +10 bonus to Dexterity (Stealth) checks as long as you remain there without moving or taking actions.

Vanish

Starting at 14th level, you can use the Hide action as a bonus action. Also, you can't be tracked by nonmagical means unless you choose to leave a trail.

Feral Senses

At 18th level, you gain preternatural senses. You can't be surprised while you are conscious. You are aware of invisible creatures within 30 feet of you, provided they aren't hidden from you and you aren't blinded or deafened.

Foe Slayer

At 20th level, once per turn when you hit a favored enemy with an attack, you can add your Wisdom modifier to the attack's damage.

Traveler Archetypes

Hunter

"I know every track, every trail, every hiding place."

Hunters specialize in tracking and eliminating specific prey—whether beasts threatening settlements or fugitives fleeing justice.

Hunter's Prey

At 3rd level, choose one feature: Colossus Slayer (extra 1d8 damage once per turn to wounded creatures), Giant Killer (reaction attack when Large+ creature attacks you), or Horde Breaker (attack additional creature within 5 ft of first target).

Defensive Tactics

At 7th level, choose one feature: Escape the Horde (opportunity attacks against you have disadvantage), Multiattack Defense (+4 AC against subsequent attacks from same creature), or Steel Will (advantage on saves against being frightened).

Multiattack

At 11th level, choose one feature: Volley (ranged attack against all creatures in 10-ft radius), or Whirlwind Attack (melee attack against all creatures within 5 feet).

Superior Hunter's Defense

At 15th level, choose one feature: Evasion, Stand Against the Tide (redirect missed melee attack to another creature), or Uncanny Dodge.

Beastmaster

"The beasts of Oz are my companions, not my servants."

Beastmasters form deep bonds with animal companions, working in partnership with creatures of the wild.

Ranger's Companion

At 3rd level, you gain a beast companion of Medium or smaller size with a challenge rating of 1/4 or lower. The companion obeys your commands and shares your initiative.

Exceptional Training

At 7th level, your companion can use its reaction to make a melee attack when you command it using your bonus action.

Bestial Fury

At 11th level, your companion can make two attacks when you command it to attack.

Share Spells

At 15th level, when you cast a spell targeting yourself, you can also affect your beast companion if it's within 30 feet.

Multiclassing

To qualify for a new class, you must have Dexterity and Wisdom scores of 13 or higher. If Traveler isn't your initial class, you gain proficiency with light armor, medium armor, shields, simple weapons, martial weapons, and one skill from the class list.

Related Pages

  • The Vinkus - Frontier territory
  • Animal Underground Railroad - Secret routes
  • Deadly Desert - Dangerous terrain

character/classes/the-performer.title: The Performer
character/classes/the-performer.content:
The Performer

"The stage is truth told through beautiful lies."

Performers are artists, musicians, actors, and storytellers who wield charisma as their instrument. In Oz's authoritarian regime, entertainment serves many purposes—state propaganda at official theaters, subtle resistance through satirical shows, or simple distraction from daily oppression. Whether headlining at Emerald City opera houses or singing rebellious ballads in Munchkinland taverns, Performers understand that art can inspire, deceive, and even change minds.

Artists and Provocateurs

Some Performers work as state-approved entertainers, carefully avoiding political content. Others use their art to smuggle forbidden ideas to audiences. Still others serve as spies, using performance as cover for intelligence gathering. All understand that in Oz, what you say matters less than how you say it—and to whom.

Class Features

Hit Points

  • Hit Dice: 1d8 per Performer level
  • Hit Points at 1st Level: 8 + your Constitution modifier
  • Hit Points at Higher Levels: 1d8 (or 5) + your Constitution modifier per Performer level after 1st

Proficiencies

  • Armor: Light armor
  • Weapons: Simple weapons, hand crossbows, longswords, rapiers, shortswords
  • Tools: Three musical instruments of your choice
  • Saving Throws: Dexterity, Charisma
  • Skills: Choose any three

Equipment

  • (a) a rapier, (b) a longsword, or (c) any simple weapon
  • (a) a diplomat's pack or (b) an entertainer's pack
  • (a) a lute or (b) any other musical instrument
  • Leather armor and a dagger

Class Features

Spellcasting

You have learned to channel magic through music, words, and gesture. Charisma is your spellcasting ability. You can use a musical instrument as a spellcasting focus.

Performance Inspiration

You can inspire others through stirring words or music. As a bonus action, choose one creature within 60 feet who can hear you. That creature gains one Inspiration die (d6). Once within the next 10 minutes, the creature can roll the die and add the number to one ability check, attack roll, or saving throw. You can use this feature a number of times equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of once), regaining expended uses on a long rest. The die becomes d8 at 5th level, d10 at 10th level, and d12 at 15th level.

Jack of All Trades

Starting at 2nd level, you can add half your proficiency bonus (rounded down) to any ability check you make that doesn't already include your proficiency bonus.

Song of Rest

Beginning at 2nd level, during a short rest, you or any friendly creatures who hear your performance regain extra hit points equal to a d6 + your Charisma modifier. This die increases to d8 at 9th level, d10 at 13th level, and d12 at 17th level.

Performance Style

At 3rd level, choose your style: Glamour (enchanting beauty and fey magic) or Satire (cutting words and mockery). Your style grants features at 3rd, 6th, and 14th level.

Expertise

At 3rd level, choose two skill proficiencies. Your proficiency bonus is doubled for ability checks using those skills. At 10th level, choose two more.

Ability Score Improvement

When you reach 4th level, and again at 8th, 12th, 16th, and 19th level, you can increase one ability score by 2, or two ability scores by 1.

Font of Inspiration

Beginning at 5th level, you regain all expended uses of Performance Inspiration when you finish a short or long rest.

Countercharm

At 6th level, you can use musical notes or words of power to disrupt mind-influencing effects. As an action, you can perform, and any friendly creatures within 30 feet have advantage on saving throws against being frightened or charmed until the start of your next turn.

Magical Secrets

At 10th level, you learn two spells from any class. At 14th level, you learn two more, and at 18th level, you learn two more. These count as Performer spells for you.

Superior Inspiration

At 20th level, when you roll initiative and have no uses of Performance Inspiration left, you regain one use.

Performance Styles

Glamour

"Beauty is a spell, and I am its caster."

Glamour Performers channel fey magic through their art, captivating audiences with supernatural beauty and charm.

Mantle of Inspiration

At 3rd level, as a bonus action, you can expend one use of your Performance Inspiration. When you do, choose a number of creatures you can see within 60 feet equal to your Charisma modifier (minimum of one). Each gains 5 temporary hit points and can immediately use its reaction to move up to its speed. The temporary hit points increase to 8 at 5th level, 11 at 10th level, and 14 at 15th level.

Enthralling Performance

At 6th level, you can charge your performance with magic. If you perform for at least 1 minute, you can attempt to inspire wonder. At the end of the performance, choose a number of humanoids within 60 feet equal to your Charisma modifier. Each must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be charmed by you for 1 hour. While charmed, the creature idolizes you and speaks highly of you. This effect ends if the creature takes damage or witnesses you or your companions doing anything harmful to it. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

Unbreakable Majesty

At 14th level, as a bonus action, you can assume a magically majestic presence for 1 minute. For the duration, whenever a creature tries to attack you for the first time on a turn, it must make a Charisma saving throw. On a failure, it can't attack you on this turn and must choose a new target or lose the attack. On a success, it can attack but has disadvantage on all saves against your spells on your next turn. Once you use this feature, you can't use it again until you finish a short or long rest.

Satire

"I speak truth to power—and make them laugh while doing it."

Satirical Performers use mockery, wit, and cutting words as weapons against tyranny and pretension.

Cutting Words

At 3rd level, when a creature you can see within 60 feet makes an attack roll, ability check, or damage roll, you can use your reaction to expend one use of Performance Inspiration, rolling the die and subtracting the number from the creature's roll. You can use this after seeing the roll but before knowing whether it succeeds or fails.

Additional Magical Secrets

At 6th level, you learn two additional spells from any class. These count as Performer spells for you but don't count against your number of spells known.

Peerless Skill

At 14th level, when you make an ability check, you can expend one use of Performance Inspiration, rolling the die and adding it to your ability check. You can do this after seeing the roll but before knowing whether you succeed or fail.

Multiclassing

To qualify for a new class, you must have a Charisma score of 13 or higher. If Performer isn't your initial class, you gain proficiency with light armor and one skill of your choice, plus one musical instrument of your choice.

Roleplaying a Performer

Art and Politics

As a Performer in Oz, consider:

  • Do you perform state-approved material or subversive art?
  • Have you ever been censored? How did you respond?
  • What message do you want your art to convey?
  • Do you see yourself as entertainer or activist—or both?

GM Notes

Performance and Propaganda

In Oz's authoritarian state, all public performance is political. State theaters spread propaganda, while underground shows spread resistance messages.

Related Pages

  • Emerald City - Theater district
  • The Wizard - Censor-in-chief

magic/spells/grimmerie/spell-list.title: Grimmerie Tradition Spells
magic/spells/grimmerie/spell-list.content:
Grimmerie Tradition Spells

"The Grimmerie speaks in tongues of fire and shadow, accessible only to those willing to pay its price."

The Grimmerie Tradition represents the most powerful and dangerous arcane magic in Oz. These spells are primarily drawn from the Grimmerie itself, the ancient book of forbidden magic that only a few—like Elphaba—have successfully decoded. These spells are available primarily to Witches and Adepts who have studied the text.

Accessing Grimmerie Spells

Unlike standard arcane magic, Grimmerie spells often require:

  • Physical access to the Grimmerie or copied pages
  • Successful Intelligence (Arcana) checks to decode (DC varies by spell level)
  • Personal sacrifice or cost beyond normal spell components
  • Risk of corruption (see Grimmerie Corruption)

Unique Grimmerie Spells

The following spells are found only in the Grimmerie and have no standard arcane equivalents:

  • Awaken Animal Consciousness (5th Circle) - The spell that created the Animals
  • Silence the Voiced (3rd Circle) - Remove speech from Animals
  • Green Elixir (2nd Circle) - The potion that affected Elphaba's mother
  • Time Fracture (7th Circle) - Cause temporal distortions

magic/spells/grimmerie/awaken-animal-con.title: Awaken Animal Consciousness
magic/spells/grimmerie/awaken-animal-con.content:
Awaken Animal Consciousness

5th-circle transmutation (Grimmerie unique)

Casting Time: 8 hours
Range: Touch
Components: V, S, M (rare herbs worth 1,000 gp, which the spell consumes)
Duration: Instantaneous

You awaken true consciousness and speech in a beast you touch. The target must have an Intelligence of 3 or less. The beast's Intelligence becomes 10, and it gains the ability to speak one language you know. The target also gains proficiency in one skill of your choice.

This is the legendary spell from the Grimmerie that created the Animals of Oz. Unlike the standard *awaken* spell, this transformation is permanent and hereditary—offspring of awakened Animals are born with consciousness.

At Higher Circles. When you cast this spell using a spell slot of 6th circle or higher, you can target one additional beast for each slot level above 5th.

GM Notes: This spell is central to Oz's history and political conflicts. Using it is considered heresy by the Unionist Church and may attract dangerous attention.

magic/spells/grimmerie/silence-the-voice.title: Silence the Voiced
magic/spells/grimmerie/silence-the-voice.content:
Silence the Voiced

3rd-circle enchantment (Grimmerie unique)

Casting Time: 1 action
Range: 60 feet
Components: V, S
Duration: Permanent until dispelled

Choose one Animal you can see within range. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature loses its ability to speak any language, though it retains its intelligence and understanding. The creature can still make animal sounds but cannot form words or cast spells with verbal components.

This cruel spell represents the magical persecution of Animals in Oz. Victims are left conscious and intelligent but unable to communicate, a fate considered worse than death by many. The spell leaves a distinctive magical signature that can be detected with *detect magic*.

The effect can be removed with *greater restoration*, *wish*, or by dispelling the magic (DC 15).

GM Notes: This spell is used by Unionist inquisitors and represents state-sanctioned magical violence. Using it marks a character as aligned with oppression.

magic/spells/grimmerie/green-elixir.title: Green Elixir
magic/spells/grimmerie/green-elixir.content:
Green Elixir

2nd-circle transmutation (Grimmerie unique)

Casting Time: 1 hour
Range: Self
Components: V, S, M (a vial of green liquid worth 50 gp)
Duration: Instantaneous

You brew the mysterious green elixir from the Grimmerie. This potion has unpredictable effects and is primarily known from its use by Elphaba's mother.

A creature that drinks the elixir must make a DC 15 Constitution saving throw. The effects vary:

  • Success: The creature gains advantage on one ability check or saving throw of its choice within the next hour.
  • Failure: Roll on the Green Elixir Effects table.

Green Elixir Effects (d6)

d6Effect
1If pregnant, the child will be born with green skin and innate magical ability
2Gain resistance to one damage type for 24 hours
3Suffer one level of exhaustion
4Gain the ability to speak with plants for 1 hour
5Skin temporarily turns green for 1d4 days
6Gain a random cantrip for 8 hours

GM Notes: This spell created Elphaba. GMs should use it sparingly and consider the narrative implications.

magic/spells/grimmerie/eldritch-blast.title: Eldritch Blast
magic/spells/grimmerie/eldritch-blast.content:
Eldritch Blast

Cantrip evocation

Casting Time: 1 action
Range: 120 feet
Components: V, S
Duration: Instantaneous

A beam of crackling green energy streaks toward a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack against the target. On a hit, the target takes 1d10 force damage.

The spell creates more than one beam when you reach higher levels: two beams at 5th level, three beams at 11th level, and four beams at 17th level. You can direct the beams at the same target or at different ones. Make a separate attack roll for each beam.

magic/spells/grimmerie-tradition.title: Grimmerie Tradition Spells
magic/spells/grimmerie-tradition.content:
Grimmerie Tradition Spells

"The Grimmerie speaks in tongues of fire and shadow, accessible only to those willing to pay its price."

The Grimmerie Tradition represents the most powerful and dangerous arcane magic in Oz. These spells are primarily drawn from the Grimmerie itself, the ancient book of forbidden magic. Available to Witches and Adepts who can decode its pages.

Cantrips (0-Circle)

Abjur

  • Eldritch Ward - You touch a willing creature. Until the spell ends, the target has resistance to one damage type of your choice: acid, cold, fire, lightning, or thunder.

Conj

  • Conjure Flame - A flickering flame appears in your hand. The flame sheds bright light in a 10-foot radius and dim light for an additional 10 feet. The flame can be used to ignite flammable objects.

Div

  • Read Intent - You touch a creature. For the duration, you have advantage on Wisdom (Insight) checks to determine if the creature is lying.

Ench

  • Compel Truth - You speak a word of power. One creature you can see within 30 feet must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be unable to speak a deliberate lie for 1 minute.

Evoc

  • Eldritch Blast - A beam of crackling green energy streaks toward a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes 1d10 force damage. The spell creates additional beams at higher levels (2 at 5th, 3 at 11th, 4 at 17th).
  • Ray of Frost - A frigid beam of blue-white light streaks toward a creature within range. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, it takes 1d8 cold damage, and its speed is reduced by 10 feet until the start of your next turn.

Illus

  • False Face - You cause your features to shift subtly. For 1 hour, you have advantage on Charisma (Deception) checks made to disguise your identity.
  • Minor Illusion - You create a sound or an image of an object within range that lasts for the duration. The illusion ends if you dismiss it or cast this spell again.

Necro

  • Chill Touch - You create a ghostly, skeletal hand that reaches out. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes 1d8 necrotic damage and can't regain hit points until the start of your next turn.

Trans

  • Prestidigitation - A minor magical trick. You can create sensory effects, light/snuff candles, clean/soil objects, chill/warm material, or make marks appear.
  • Mage Hand - A spectral hand appears and can manipulate objects, open unlocked doors, or retrieve items within 30 feet.

1st-Circle Spells

Abjur

  • Shield - An invisible barrier of magical force appears and protects you. Until the start of your next turn, you have a +5 bonus to AC.
  • Protection from Scrying - You ward one willing creature you touch. For 8 hours, divination magic can't target that creature or perceive them through scrying sensors.
  • Mage Armor - You touch a willing creature who isn't wearing armor. Until the spell ends, the target's base AC becomes 13 + its Dexterity modifier.

Conj

  • Find Familiar - You gain the service of a familiar, a spirit that takes an animal form you choose. The familiar can deliver touch spells and acts independently but obeys your commands.
  • Grease - Slick grease covers the ground in a 10-foot square. Each creature in the area must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw or fall prone.
  • Fog Cloud - You create a 20-foot-radius sphere of fog. The area is heavily obscured.

Div

  • Identify - You learn the properties of one magical item or the spell affecting one creature or object.
  • Detect Magic - For 10 minutes, you sense the presence of magic within 30 feet and can determine its school.
  • Comprehend Languages - For 1 hour, you understand any spoken language you hear and can read any written language you see.

Ench

  • Charm Person - You attempt to charm a humanoid you can see. It must make a Wisdom saving throw, and does so with advantage if you or your companions are fighting it. If it fails, it is charmed for 1 hour.
  • Sleep - Creatures within 20 feet of a point you choose fall unconscious in order of their current hit points, starting with the lowest, up to 5d8 total hit points.

Evoc

  • Burning Hands - A thin sheet of flames shoots from your outstretched fingertips. Each creature in a 15-foot cone must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 3d6 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success.
  • Magic Missile - You create three glowing darts of magical force. Each dart hits a creature of your choice that you can see within range, dealing 1d4 + 1 force damage.
  • Thunderwave - A wave of thunderous force sweeps out from you. Each creature in a 15-foot cube must make a Constitution saving throw, taking 2d8 thunder damage on a failure and being pushed 10 feet away.

Illus

  • Disguise Self - You make yourself—including clothing, armor, weapons, and other belongings—look different for 1 hour or until you dismiss it.
  • Silent Image - You create the image of an object, a creature, or some other visible phenomenon that is no larger than a 15-foot cube.
  • Color Spray - A dazzling array of flashing, colored light springs from your hand. Roll 6d10; creatures in a 15-foot cone are blinded in order of their hit points, starting with the lowest.

Necro

  • Cause Fear - You awaken the sense of mortality in one creature you can see. It must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or become frightened of you until the spell ends.
  • Ray of Sickness - Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target takes 2d8 poison damage and must make a Constitution saving throw or be poisoned until the end of your next turn.

Trans

  • Feather Fall - Choose up to five falling creatures within range. A falling creature's rate of descent slows to 60 feet per round until the spell ends.
  • Expeditious Retreat - You can take the Dash action as a bonus action on each of your turns for the duration (10 minutes).
  • Jump - You touch a creature. The creature's jump distance is tripled for 1 minute.

2nd-Circle Spells

Abjur

  • Arcane Lock - You touch a closed door, window, gate, chest, or other entryway, and it becomes locked for the duration. You and creatures you designate can open it normally.

Conj

  • Misty Step - Briefly surrounded by silvery mist, you teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space that you can see.
  • Cloud of Daggers - You fill the air with spinning daggers in a 5-foot cube. A creature takes 4d4 slashing damage when it enters the area for the first time on a turn or starts its turn there.

Div

  • Detect Thoughts - You can read the surface thoughts of creatures within 30 feet. The target can make a Wisdom saving throw to resist.
  • See Invisibility - For 1 hour, you see invisible creatures and objects as if they were visible.
  • Locate Object - Sense the direction to an object you describe that is within 1,000 feet.

Ench

  • Hold Person - Choose a humanoid you can see. The target must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be paralyzed for the duration (up to 1 minute).
  • Suggestion - You suggest a course of activity and magically influence a creature you can see. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw or pursue the course of action you described.
  • Crown of Madness - One humanoid you can see must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, it is charmed and must use its action to make a melee attack against a creature other than itself that you mentally choose.

Evoc

  • Scorching Ray - You create three rays of fire and hurl them at targets within range. Make a ranged spell attack for each ray. On a hit, the target takes 2d6 fire damage.
  • Shatter - A sudden loud ringing noise erupts from a point of your choice within range. Each creature in a 10-foot-radius sphere must make a Constitution saving throw, taking 3d8 thunder damage on a failed save.

Illus

  • Invisibility - A creature you touch becomes invisible until the spell ends. Anything the target is wearing or carrying is invisible as long as it is on the target's person.
  • Mirror Image - Three illusory duplicates of yourself appear. Each time a creature targets you with an attack, roll a d20 to determine whether the attack targets you or an illusion.
  • Blur - Your body becomes blurred. For the duration, any creature has disadvantage on attack rolls against you.

Necro

  • Ray of Enfeeblement - A black beam of enervating energy springs from your finger. Make a ranged spell attack. On a hit, the target deals only half damage with weapon attacks that use Strength.
  • Blindness/Deafness - You can blind or deafen a foe. The target must make a Constitution saving throw or be blinded or deafened (your choice) for 1 minute.

Trans

  • Levitate - One creature or object of your choice rises vertically, up to 20 feet, and remains suspended there for the duration.
  • Alter Self - You assume a different form. You can change your appearance, adapt to an aquatic environment, or grow natural weapons.
  • Enlarge/Reduce - You cause a creature or object to grow larger or smaller for the duration.

3rd-Circle Spells

Abjur

  • Counterspell - You attempt to interrupt a creature in the process of casting a spell. If the spell is 3rd circle or lower, it fails. For higher circles, make an ability check.
  • Dispel Magic - Any spell of 3rd circle or lower on a target ends. For higher circles, make an ability check using your spellcasting ability.
  • Remove Curse - All curses affecting one creature or object end.

Conj

  • Conjure Animals - You summon fey spirits that take the form of beasts. They appear in unoccupied spaces you can see and obey your commands.

Div

  • Clairvoyance - You create an invisible sensor within range in a location familiar to you or in an obvious unfamiliar location.
  • Tongues - A creature you touch can understand any spoken language it hears, and when it speaks, any creature that knows at least one language can understand it.

Ench

  • Fear - You project a phantasmal image of a creature's worst fears. Each creature in a 30-foot cone must make a Wisdom saving throw or drop what it's holding and become frightened.
  • Hypnotic Pattern - You create a twisting pattern of colors. Each creature in a 30-foot cube must make a Wisdom saving throw or become charmed and incapacitated.

Evoc

  • Fireball - A bright streak flashes from your pointing finger to a point you choose within range and blossoms into a roaring explosion. Each creature in a 20-foot-radius sphere must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 8d6 fire damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success.
  • Lightning Bolt - A stroke of lightning forming a line 100 feet long and 5 feet wide blasts from you. Each creature in the line must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 8d6 lightning damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success.

Illus

  • Major Image - You create the image of an object, a creature, or some other visible phenomenon that is no larger than a 20-foot cube. The image includes sound, smell, and temperature appropriate to the thing depicted.

Necro

  • Animate Dead - This spell creates an undead servant from a corpse. The creature becomes a skeleton or zombie (your choice) and obeys your commands.
  • Vampiric Touch - Make a melee spell attack. On a hit, the target takes 3d6 necrotic damage, and you regain hit points equal to half the necrotic damage dealt.
  • Speak with Dead - You grant the semblance of life to a corpse, allowing it to answer up to five questions.

Trans

  • Fly - You touch a willing creature. The target gains a flying speed of 60 feet for the duration (10 minutes).
  • Haste - Choose a willing creature. Until the spell ends, the target's speed is doubled, it gains a +2 bonus to AC, has advantage on Dexterity saving throws, and gains an additional action on each of its turns.
  • Slow - You alter time around up to six creatures. Each target must make a Wisdom saving throw or be affected by slow, having its speed halved and suffering other penalties.

4th-Circle Spells

Abjur

  • Banishment - You attempt to send one creature to another plane of existence. The target must succeed on a Charisma saving throw or be banished.

Conj

  • Dimension Door - You teleport yourself and up to one willing creature to a spot within 500 feet.
  • Conjure Minor Elementals - You summon elementals that appear in unoccupied spaces and obey your commands.

Div

  • Arcane Eye - You create an invisible, magical eye that hovers in the air for the duration. You mentally receive visual information from the eye.
  • Locate Creature - Describe or name a creature familiar to you. You sense the direction to the creature's location if it is within 1,000 feet.

Ench

  • Dominate Beast - You attempt to beguile a beast. It must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be charmed by you for the duration.
  • Compulsion - Each creature of your choice in a 30-foot cube must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, it must move in a direction you choose on each of its turns.

Evoc

  • Ice Storm - Hail falls in a 20-foot-radius, 40-foot-high cylinder. Each creature in the area must make a Dexterity saving throw, taking 2d8 bludgeoning damage and 4d6 cold damage on a failure.
  • Wall of Fire - You create a wall of fire on a solid surface. One side deals 5d8 fire damage to creatures within 10 feet.

Illus

  • Greater Invisibility - You or a creature you touch becomes invisible until the spell ends. Attacking or casting spells doesn't end the invisibility.
  • Hallucinatory Terrain - You make natural terrain in a 150-foot cube look, sound, and smell like some other sort of terrain.

Necro

  • Blight - Necromantic energy washes over a creature you can see. The target must make a Constitution saving throw, taking 8d8 necrotic damage on a failed save, or half as much on a success.

Trans

  • Polymorph - You transform a creature into a beast with a CR equal to or less than the target's level or CR. The target's statistics are replaced by those of the beast.
  • Stone Shape - You touch a stone object or section of stone no larger than Medium and form it into any shape that suits your purpose.

5th-Circle Spells

Abjur

  • Wall of Force - An invisible wall of force springs into existence. Nothing can physically pass through the wall.

Conj

  • Teleportation Circle - You create a circle on the ground. When you finish casting, a portal opens, linking your location with a permanent teleportation circle whose sigil sequence you know.
  • Conjure Elemental - You summon an elemental servant that appears in an unoccupied space.

Div

  • Scrying - You can see and hear a particular creature you choose. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw, modified by how well you know it.
  • Contact Other Plane - You mentally contact a demigod, elemental prince, or cosmic entity and ask up to five questions. You risk madness if your Intelligence is too low.

Ench

  • Dominate Person - You attempt to beguile a humanoid. It must succeed on a Wisdom saving throw or be charmed and under your control.
  • Modify Memory - You attempt to reshape another creature's memories. The target must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failure, you can modify up to 10 minutes of its memories.
  • Geas - You place a magical command on a creature. It must carry out some service or refrain from some action, or take 5d10 psychic damage each day it doesn't obey.

Evoc

  • Cone of Cold - A blast of cold air erupts from your hands. Each creature in a 60-foot cone must make a Constitution saving throw, taking 8d8 cold damage on a failure.

Necro

  • Cloudkill - You create a 20-foot-radius sphere of poisonous yellow-green fog. The fog spreads around corners and is heavily obscuring. Each creature in the area takes 5d8 poison damage.
  • Animate Objects - Objects come to life at your command. Choose up to ten nonmagical objects that are not being worn or carried. Medium targets count as two, Large as four, Huge as eight.

Unique Grimmerie Spells

The following spells exist only in the Grimmerie and represent its most dangerous secrets:

5th Circle

  • Awaken Animal Consciousness - 8 hour casting time. You touch a beast with Intelligence 3 or less. Its Intelligence becomes 10, and it gains speech and one skill proficiency. Unlike standard *awaken*, this transformation is permanent and hereditary. This spell created the Animals of Oz. Using it is considered heresy by the Unionist Church.

3rd Circle

  • Silence the Voiced - Choose one Animal within 60 feet. It must make a Wisdom saving throw or permanently lose its ability to speak. The creature retains intelligence but cannot form words or cast spells with verbal components. Can be removed with *greater restoration* or *wish*.

2nd Circle

  • Green Elixir - 1 hour casting time. You brew the mysterious green potion. A creature that drinks it makes a DC 15 Constitution save. On success, gain advantage on one check within 1 hour. On failure, roll d6: (1) if pregnant, child born green-skinned with magical ability, (2-6) various temporary magical effects. This spell affected Elphaba's mother.

7th Circle

  • Time Fracture - You cause temporal distortions in a 30-foot radius. Time moves erratically; creatures must make Wisdom saves or become disoriented, gaining disadvantage on all rolls. Some effects may persist as time anomalies.

9th Circle

  • Soul Transfer - You attempt to move a willing soul from one body to another prepared vessel. Both vessels must be present. Requires intense concentration and carries risk of permanent soul damage. This is theoretical even within the Grimmerie's pages.

Related Pages

  • The Grimmerie - Source of these spells
  • The Witch - Primary caster class
  • The Adept - Academic caster class
  • Grimmerie Corruption - Dangers of these spells

magic/spells/domingon-tradition.title: Domingon Tradition Spells
magic/spells/domingon-tradition.content:
Domingon Tradition Spells

"In trance, we walk between worlds. In rhythm, we speak with spirits. In blood, we honor the ancestors."

The Domingon tradition is the mystical practice of the Quadling people, blending ancestral worship, spirit communion, and trance magic. Unlike the rigid hierarchies of Grimmerie or Unionist magic, Domingon draws power from collective ritual, ancestral memory, and the liminal spaces between waking and dreaming.

This tradition is primarily accessible to Adepts who choose the Domingon tradition, Quadling characters with cultural background, and certain Witches who have learned from Quadling practitioners.

Tradition Characteristics

  • Source: Ancestral spirits, collective memory, ritual trance
  • Method: Drumming, chanting, dancing, blood offerings
  • Strength: Divination, spirit communion, group rituals
  • Limitation: Often requires ritual preparation and communal participation

Cantrips (0-Level)

Divin

  • Ancestral Whisper - You hear faint whispers from beyond, granting advantage on one Insight or History check within 1 minute.
  • Spirit Sight - You can see 60 feet in darkness as if it were dim light for 1 hour. Magical darkness appears as swirling mist.

Necro

  • Death's Touch - Touch one creature. It must succeed on a Constitution save or take 1d6 necrotic damage. Damage increases by 1d6 at 5th (2d6), 11th (3d6), and 17th level (4d6).

1st-Circle Spells

Divin

  • Ancestor's Counsel - You enter a brief trance and ask your ancestors one question about the past. The GM provides a truthful answer, though it may be cryptic.
  • Drumbeat Divination - By drumming for 10 minutes, you gain insight into the near future. You have advantage on initiative for the next hour.

Necro

  • Blood Bond - You take 1d6 damage and target one willing creature within 30 feet. For 1 hour, you can communicate telepathically and sense each other's general emotional state.

2nd-Circle Spells

Divin

  • Trance Vision - You enter a trance for 1 minute and can see through the eyes of any creature you've met within 1 mile. The creature is unaware but feels briefly disoriented.

Ench

  • Ritual Dance - Up to 6 willing creatures within 30 feet join in a ritual dance. For 10 minutes, they have advantage on saves against being charmed or frightened and gain +2 to AC.

Necro

  • Speak with Ancestors - You contact the spirit of a dead creature. It can answer 3 questions truthfully about events it witnessed in life or knowledge it possessed.

3rd-Circle Spells

Divin

  • Collective Memory - You tap into ancestral memory to gain proficiency in one skill or tool for 8 hours. Multiple casters can share their collective knowledge.

Necro

  • Spirit Walk - Your spirit leaves your body for up to 1 hour. Your body appears dead but is protected. Your spirit form is invisible and can pass through objects but cannot interact physically.

4th-Circle Spells

Divin

  • Prophetic Trance - You enter a deep trance for 10 minutes. The GM reveals one major event that will occur within the next 24 hours, though not how to prevent or cause it.

5th-Circle Spells

Necro

  • Ancestral Army - You summon the spirits of 10 ancestors who appear as spectral warriors. They have the statistics of shadows but deal radiant damage. They obey your commands for 1 hour.

Domingon-Only Spells

These spells are unique to the Domingon tradition and cannot be learned through other magical traditions without explicit training from a Quadling spirit-walker.

Ritual of the Red River (6th Circle)

School: Necromancy (ritual)
Casting Time: 1 hour
Range: 30 feet
Components: V, S, M (a bowl of blood from willing participants)
Duration: 24 hours

You perform an ancient Quadling ritual that binds a group together in blood. Up to 12 willing creatures participate. For the duration:

  • All participants can sense each other's location and emotional state within 1 mile
  • When one participant takes damage, each other participant can choose to take up to half that damage to reduce the original damage by the same amount
  • Participants have advantage on saves against being charmed or frightened while within 60 feet of each other
  • If one participant dies, all others immediately know and can speak to their spirit for 1 minute

Dance of the Dead (7th Circle)

School: Necromancy
Casting Time: 1 action
Range: 60 feet
Components: V, S, M (drums and ritual paint)
Duration: Concentration, up to 10 minutes

You begin a ritual dance that calls forth ancestral spirits to possess corpses. Up to 6 humanoid corpses within range animate as spectral warriors. They use the statistics of wights but deal radiant damage and have resistance to all damage except force. They obey your commands and fight with the skill of ancient Quadling warriors. When the spell ends or a corpse drops to 0 hit points, the spirit departs peacefully.

Cultural Significance

Domingon magic is inseparable from Quadling culture. The tradition emphasizes:

  • Community: Many spells are more powerful when cast with multiple participants
  • Respect: Spirits must be approached with proper ritual and offerings
  • Memory: The dead are not gone; they remain accessible through trance and ritual
  • Liminality: Power comes from walking between worlds—waking/dreaming, living/dead, material/spiritual

Learning Domingon Magic

Unlike Grimmerie magic which can be learned from books, Domingon magic requires personal instruction from a spirit-walker or participation in Quadling community rituals. Non-Quadlings who learn this tradition often do so through:

  • Extended time living in Quadling communities
  • Marriage or adoption into Quadling families
  • Being chosen by ancestral spirits in dreams
  • Rescue or aid given to Quadling people, earning their trust

GM Notes

Ritual Requirements

Many Domingon spells benefit from or require ritual casting. Consider requiring:

  • Drums, rattles, or other percussion instruments
  • Ritual body paint or scarification
  • Circle of participants (even if they're not spellcasters)
  • Blood offerings (minor cuts, not life-threatening)
  • Specific moon phases or times of day

Spirit Interaction

Ancestral spirits in Domingon magic are not mere spell effects—they're characters. Give them:

  • Distinct personalities based on their lives
  • Opinions about current events and how the living honor the dead
  • Willingness to help or refuse based on proper respect being shown
  • Cultural knowledge from their era

Political Context

In the Wizard's Oz, Domingon magic is:

  • Viewed with suspicion by Emerald City authorities
  • Tolerated in Quadling Country but monitored
  • Sometimes confused with Witchcraft by ignorant officials
  • A source of cultural resistance and Quadling identity
  • Increasingly rare as younger Quadlings assimilate to Emerald City culture

Related Pages

  • Quadling - The people who practice this tradition
  • The Adept - Can choose Domingon as their magical tradition
  • Grimmerie Tradition - Contrasting arcane tradition
  • The Witch - May learn Domingon magic through cultural exchange

magic/spells/unionist-tradition.title: Unionist Tradition Spells
magic/spells/unionist-tradition.content:
Unionist Tradition Spells

"By the authority of the Unnamed God, I command obedience. Through divine power, I impose order upon chaos."

The Unionist tradition represents the divine magic granted by the Unnamed God to faithful servants of the state religion. Unlike the wild, unpredictable magic of Witches or the nature-based power of Lurlinites, Unionist magic emphasizes control, hierarchy, and conformity.

This tradition is primarily accessible to Unionists (the divine caster class), though some Adepts who study theological magic may access certain spells.

Tradition Characteristics

  • Source: The Unnamed God, state-sanctioned divine power
  • Method: Prayer, holy symbols, ritual orthodoxy
  • Strength: Enchantment, control magic, healing that enforces conformity
  • Limitation: Requires faith in the Unnamed God and adherence to church doctrine

Cantrips (0-Level)

Abjur

  • Sacred Ward - You touch one creature. Until the start of your next turn, it has resistance to damage from the next attack that hits it.

Divin

  • Detect Heresy - You know if any creature within 30 feet has cast an arcane spell in the last hour or is an Animal. This reveals the presence but not the identity.

Ench

  • Divine Presence - Your voice carries divine authority. For 1 minute, you have advantage on Intimidation and Persuasion checks against creatures who can hear you.

Evoc

  • Sacred Flame - Flame-like radiance descends on one creature you can see within 60 feet. The target must succeed on a Dexterity save or take 1d8 radiant damage. Damage increases at higher levels (2d8 at 5th, 3d8 at 11th, 4d8 at 17th).

1st-Circle Spells

Abjur

  • Shield of Faith - A shimmering field appears around a creature within 60 feet, granting +2 bonus to AC for 10 minutes.

Divin

  • Detect Evil and Good - For 10 minutes, you sense the presence of celestials, fiends, undead, and powerful evil or good creatures within 30 feet.

Ench

  • Command - You speak a one-word command to a creature within 60 feet. It must obey on its next turn or succeed on a Wisdom save. Commands: Approach, Drop, Flee, Grovel, Halt.
  • Bless - Up to 3 creatures within 30 feet gain +1d4 to attack rolls and saving throws for 1 minute.

Evoc

  • Cure Wounds - A creature you touch regains 1d8 + your spellcasting modifier hit points. Higher spell slots restore more (2d8 at 2nd level, 3d8 at 3rd, etc.).
  • Guiding Bolt - Make a ranged spell attack against a creature within 120 feet. On hit, it takes 4d6 radiant damage and the next attack against it has advantage.

2nd-Circle Spells

Abjur

  • Lesser Restoration - You touch a creature and end one disease or condition (blinded, deafened, paralyzed, or poisoned).

Divin

  • Zone of Truth - Creatures in a 15-foot radius sphere must succeed on a Charisma save or be unable to speak deliberate lies for 10 minutes.

Ench

  • Hold Person - Choose a humanoid within 60 feet. It must succeed on a Wisdom save or be paralyzed for 1 minute. It can repeat the save at the end of each turn.
  • Calm Emotions - Each humanoid in a 20-foot radius sphere must make a Charisma save. On failure, you suppress strong emotions (charm, fright, rage) or make hostile creatures indifferent for 1 minute.

Evoc

  • Spiritual Weapon - You create a floating spectral weapon within 60 feet. As a bonus action, you can move it and make a melee spell attack, dealing 1d8 + spellcasting modifier force damage.

3rd-Circle Spells

Abjur

  • Dispel Magic - Choose one creature, object, or magical effect within 120 feet. Any spell of 3rd level or lower ends. For higher levels, make an ability check (DC 10 + spell level).

Ench

  • Mass Healing Word - Up to 6 creatures within 60 feet each regain 1d4 + spellcasting modifier hit points. Cast as a bonus action.

Evoc

  • Spirit Guardians - Spectral figures swirl around you in a 15-foot radius for 10 minutes. You choose which creatures are affected. They must succeed on a Wisdom save or take 3d8 radiant damage (half on success) when they enter or start their turn in the area. Their speed is halved.

4th-Circle Spells

Abjur

  • Guardian of Faith - A spectral guardian appears in an unoccupied space within 30 feet. Any hostile creature that moves within 10 feet must succeed on a Dexterity save or take 20 radiant damage. The guardian vanishes after dealing 60 total damage.

Ench

  • Compulsion - Creatures within 30 feet must succeed on a Wisdom save or use their movement to go in a direction you choose on their turn for 1 minute.

5th-Circle Spells

Ench

  • Dominate Person - One humanoid within 60 feet must succeed on a Wisdom save or be charmed for 1 minute. You have a telepathic link and can command it. It repeats the save when it takes damage.

Evoc

  • Flame Strike - A vertical column of divine fire roars down in a 10-foot radius, 40-foot high cylinder. Creatures inside make a Dexterity save, taking 4d6 fire damage and 4d6 radiant damage on a failed save, or half on success.

Unionist-Only Spells

These spells are unique to the Unionist tradition and reflect the specific theological doctrine of the state church.

Suppress Animal Consciousness (2nd Circle)

School: Enchantment
Casting Time: 1 action
Range: 60 feet
Components: V, S, M (holy symbol of the Unnamed God)
Duration: 1 hour

You target one Animal within range. The Animal must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the Animal's consciousness is suppressed for the duration. While suppressed:

  • The Animal cannot speak any language and can only make natural animal sounds
  • The Animal's Intelligence score is reduced to that of a non-conscious animal of its type (usually 2-3)
  • The Animal retains vague awareness of who it was but cannot access complex thoughts or memories
  • The Animal can repeat the saving throw at the end of each hour

This spell is commonly used by Inquisitors to "prove" that Animals are merely beasts and not truly conscious beings.

Compel Orthodoxy (3rd Circle)

School: Enchantment
Casting Time: 1 action
Range: 30 feet
Components: V, S, M (a Unionist holy text)
Duration: 8 hours

You speak a brief sermon enforcing Unionist doctrine. Choose up to 6 creatures within range. Each must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, for the duration the creature:

  • Cannot speak against the Unionist faith without great mental strain (takes 1d6 psychic damage per sentence)
  • Feels compelled to attend religious services and mouth prayers
  • Views defiance of church authority as fundamentally wrong
  • Can repeat the save if someone presents compelling counter-arguments (GM discretion)

This spell is frequently used during mass conversions and re-education programs.

Mark the Heretic (1st Circle)

School: Divination
Casting Time: 1 action
Range: Touch
Components: V, S, M (holy symbol pressed to target's flesh)
Duration: 7 days

You touch one creature and brand it with an invisible mark of heresy. For the duration:

  • You always know the direction and approximate distance to the marked creature
  • Other Unionists who cast detect heresy can sense the mark within 30 feet
  • The marked creature has disadvantage on Charisma checks when interacting with faithful Unionists
  • The mark can only be removed with remove curse or similar magic

Enforced Confession (4th Circle)

School: Enchantment
Casting Time: 1 minute
Range: Touch
Components: V, S, M (confession chamber or interrogation tools)
Duration: 10 minutes

You touch one restrained creature and invoke the Unnamed God's judgment. The creature must make a Wisdom saving throw with disadvantage. On a failed save, for the duration:

  • The creature feels overwhelming guilt and desire to confess sins
  • When asked a direct question, it must answer truthfully or take 4d6 psychic damage
  • The creature will voluntarily reveal information it believes is sinful or heretical
  • False confessions extracted this way feel true to the confessor in the moment

GM Note: This spell is morally reprehensible and used primarily by the Inquisition. Good-aligned characters should face consequences for using it.

Divine Mandate (6th Circle)

School: Enchantment
Casting Time: 1 action
Range: 60 feet
Components: V, S, M (a writ of official church authority)
Duration: 24 hours

You invoke the full authority of the Unnamed God to issue a divine command. Choose up to 12 creatures within range who can hear you. Each must make a Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save, the creature is affected by a geas-like compulsion to complete one specific task you describe (no more than 25 words). The task must be something completable within 24 hours and cannot be directly suicidal. While under this compulsion:

  • The creature takes 5d10 psychic damage each time it acts against your command
  • The creature views completing the task as a sacred duty
  • The creature can repeat the save if it moves more than 1 mile from where it was commanded

This spell is used to mobilize Unionist mobs, conscript labor, and suppress dissent.

Cultural Significance

Unionist magic is deeply intertwined with state power in Oz:

  • Authority: Only ordained clergy can access the full Unionist spell list
  • Control: Many spells focus on compelling obedience and suppressing dissent
  • Proof: The fact that Unionist magic works is cited as evidence the Unnamed God approves of church doctrine
  • Persecution: Spells like Suppress Animal Consciousness are used to justify oppression

Learning Unionist Magic

Unlike arcane traditions that can be self-taught, Unionist magic requires:

  • Formal ordination by the Unionist Church
  • Years of seminary training in theology and doctrine
  • Demonstrated faith in the Unnamed God
  • Adherence to church hierarchy and rules

Characters who lose faith or are excommunicated may lose access to some or all Unionist spells, at GM discretion.

GM Notes

Moral Complexity

Unionist magic presents difficult questions:

  • The magic genuinely works—does this mean the Unnamed God is real?
  • If the Unnamed God is real, does divine power justify oppression?
  • Can a Unionist character be heroic while serving an unjust institution?
  • What happens when faith conflicts with morality?

Restrictions and Consequences

Consider implementing:

  • Divine Disapproval: Using Unionist magic to protect Animals or heretics might require ability checks or cause spell failure
  • Institutional Oversight: Church superiors may demand reports on spell use
  • Loss of Power: Publicly defying church doctrine could result in spell slots not recovering
  • Redemption Arcs: Fallen Unionists might regain power through atonement or finding a new understanding of the divine

Unionist NPCs

Unionist spellcasters make compelling NPCs because they can be:

  • True believers who genuinely think they're saving souls
  • Cynical manipulators using religion for power
  • Conflicted clergy struggling with doubt
  • Reformers trying to change the church from within

Related Pages

  • The Unionist - Primary class using this tradition
  • Unionism - The state religion
  • The Unnamed God - Source of divine power
  • The Lurlinite - Rival divine tradition
  • Animals - Primary targets of Unionist persecution

magic/spells/lurline-tradition.title: Lurline Tradition Spells
magic/spells/lurline-tradition.content:
Lurline Tradition Spells

"Before the Unnamed God, before the Wizard, before the Emerald City—there was Lurline. And she remembers."

The Lurline tradition is the oldest magical practice in Oz, predating both the Unionist Church and the Wizard's conquest. Named for the fairy queen Lurline who is said to have blessed Oz with magic, this tradition draws power from the land itself, from ancient fey spirits, and from the deep memory of nature.

This tradition is primarily accessible to Lurlinites (the druid-equivalent class), though some Animals instinctively access its power, and rare Witches learn it through communion with nature spirits.

Tradition Characteristics

  • Source: Lurline's blessing, the land of Oz, fey spirits, primal nature
  • Method: Ritual connection to nature, spoken prayers in Old Ozian, communion with spirits
  • Strength: Nature magic, healing, transformation, communion with beasts
  • Limitation: Weakened in urban areas, requires connection to natural Oz

Cantrips (0-Level)

Conj

  • Produce Flame - A flickering green flame appears in your hand for 10 minutes, shedding bright light in 10 feet. You can hurl it as a ranged spell attack (30 feet) dealing 1d8 fire damage.

Divin

  • Guidance - Touch a creature. Once in the next minute, it can add 1d4 to one ability check of its choice.

Trans

  • Shillelagh - A club or quarterstaff you hold becomes magical for 1 minute. It deals 1d8 damage and uses your spellcasting modifier for attacks.
  • Druidcraft - You create a minor nature effect: predict weather for 24 hours, make a flower bloom, create a sensory effect like rustling leaves, or light/snuff a candle.

1st-Circle Spells

Abjur

  • Sanctuary - You ward a creature within 30 feet. Any creature trying to target it with an attack or harmful spell must first make a Wisdom save or choose a new target. Lasts 1 minute or until the warded creature attacks.

Conj

  • Entangle - Vines and plants sprout from the ground in a 20-foot square within 90 feet. Creatures in the area must succeed on a Strength save or be restrained. Lasts 1 minute; creatures can use their action to try to escape.
  • Goodberry - Up to 10 berries appear in your hand. Each restores 1 hit point and provides nutrition for one day. They lose potency after 24 hours.

Evoc

  • Cure Wounds - A creature you touch regains 1d8 + your spellcasting modifier hit points.

Trans

  • Speak with Animals - For 10 minutes, you can communicate with beasts. This does NOT grant consciousness to non-Animal beasts, but you can ask simple questions and receive simple answers.

2nd-Circle Spells

Abjur

  • Lesser Restoration - You touch a creature and end one disease or condition (blinded, deafened, paralyzed, or poisoned).

Conj

  • Spike Growth - Ground in a 20-foot radius within 150 feet becomes covered in sharp thorns. It's difficult terrain and creatures moving through take 2d4 piercing damage per 5 feet traveled.

Divin

  • Locate Animals or Plants - Describe or name a specific kind of beast or plant. You sense its direction and distance within 5 miles.

Trans

  • Barkskin - A creature you touch has its AC become at least 16 for 1 hour (concentration).
  • Pass Without Trace - You and up to 10 willing creatures within 30 feet gain +10 to Stealth checks and leave no tracks for 1 hour.

3rd-Circle Spells

Conj

  • Call Lightning - A storm cloud appears above you in a 60-foot radius cylinder. As an action each turn, you can call down a lightning bolt on a point within range. Creatures within 5 feet make a Dexterity save, taking 3d10 lightning damage on failure (half on success). Lasts 10 minutes.

Divin

  • Speak with Plants - For 10 minutes, plants within 30 feet become animated and can answer questions about events in the area within the past day. You can also make difficult terrain passable.

Trans

  • Plant Growth - Plants in a 100-foot radius overgrow, creating difficult terrain. Or, you enrich land in a half-mile radius, doubling crop yield for 1 year.

4th-Circle Spells

Conj

  • Conjure Woodland Beings - You summon fey creatures or nature spirits that appear in unoccupied spaces within 60 feet. They are friendly and obey your commands for 1 hour.

Trans

  • Polymorph - Transform a creature within 60 feet into a beast with CR equal to or less than its level. It retains personality but uses the beast's statistics. Lasts 1 hour or until it drops to 0 hit points.

5th-Circle Spells

Conj

  • Tree Stride - You gain the ability to enter a tree and teleport to another tree of the same kind within 500 feet. You can do this once per round for 1 minute.

Trans

  • Reincarnate - You touch a dead humanoid who has been dead no more than 10 days. It returns to life in a new body determined randomly (could be a different race). The new form is adult and healthy.

Lurline-Only Spells

These spells are unique to the Lurline tradition and reflect the ancient, primal magic of Oz before civilization.

Lurline's Blessing (1st Circle)

School: Enchantment
Casting Time: 1 action
Range: Touch
Components: V, S, M (a flower native to Oz)
Duration: 8 hours

You touch a creature and invoke the protection of Lurline, the fairy queen who blessed Oz. For the duration, the creature gains the following benefits:

  • Cannot be magically tracked or scryed upon
  • Has advantage on saves against enchantment spells cast by servants of the Unnamed God
  • Animals (both conscious and unconscious) will not attack unless provoked
  • Can understand (but not speak) Old Ozian, the language of nature spirits

Awaken Animal (5th Circle)

School: Transmutation
Casting Time: 8 hours
Range: Touch
Components: V, S, M (rare herbs worth 1000oz consumed by the spell)
Duration: Instantaneous

You spend 8 hours in ritual communion with a Large or smaller beast with Intelligence 3 or lower. At the end of the ritual, the beast becomes an Animal—gaining full consciousness, intelligence (Intelligence becomes 10), and the ability to speak all languages you know. The Animal is charmed by you for 30 days or until you or your companions harm it.

GM Note: This is how most Animals come into being in Oz. It's extraordinarily controversial and considered heresy by the Unionist Church. Using this spell publicly will result in immediate persecution.

Memory of the Land (3rd Circle)

School: Divination (ritual)
Casting Time: 1 minute
Range: Self
Components: V, S, M (dirt or plant matter from the location)
Duration: Concentration, up to 10 minutes

You touch the ground and commune with the land itself, accessing its ancient memory. The land shows you visions of significant events that occurred in this location within the past 100 years. You see:

  • Major battles or deaths
  • Powerful magic being cast
  • The presence of unusual creatures
  • Natural or unnatural disasters

The visions are dreamlike and symbolic—you feel the emotions and understand the significance but don't get perfect detail. The land remembers violence, magic, and ecological change most clearly.

Green Sanctuary (4th Circle)

School: Abjuration
Casting Time: 10 minutes
Range: Self (30-foot radius)
Components: V, S, M (seeds from 7 different Ozian plants)
Duration: 8 hours

You create a protective grove around your location. For the duration, the 30-foot radius around you becomes:

  • Hidden from divination magic (functions as nondetection)
  • Difficult terrain for creatures you designate as hostile
  • Comfortable temperature regardless of weather
  • Naturally alarmed—you're awakened if hostile creatures enter
  • Healing—creatures who complete a long rest inside regain an additional 1d8 hit points per hour of rest

The sanctuary ends if you leave the area. This spell is how underground Lurlinites create safe houses for Animal refugees.

Call the Wild Hunt (6th Circle)

School: Conjuration
Casting Time: 1 action
Range: Self
Components: V, S, M (a horn carved from ancient wood)
Duration: Concentration, up to 1 hour

You blow a horn and summon the Wild Hunt—spectral fey riders that served Lurline before the Wizard came to Oz. 2d4 spectral riders appear mounted on ghostly beasts. Each rider has the statistics of a knight but deals radiant damage and has resistance to non-magical weapons. The Hunt:

  • Obeys your telepathic commands
  • Hunts down one target you designate (must have seen or have a piece of them)
  • Can track prey unerringly within 10 miles
  • Vanishes when the target is defeated or the spell ends

GM Note: The Wild Hunt is terrifying and associated with the old, wild magic of Oz. Using this spell marks the caster as a powerful and dangerous Lurlinite.

Speak with Animal Consciousness (2nd Circle)

School: Divination (ritual)
Casting Time: 1 action
Range: 30 feet
Components: V, S
Duration: 10 minutes

Unlike speak with animals, this spell specifically allows you to communicate with conscious Animals telepathically, even if you don't share a language. For the duration:

  • You and the Animal can communicate complex thoughts and emotions
  • The Animal can share memories and experiences visually
  • You gain advantage on Persuasion checks with the Animal
  • The Animal can sense your intentions (you can't lie convincingly)

This spell is how Lurlinites coordinate with Animal resistance fighters without speaking aloud and risking detection.

Cultural Significance

Lurline magic is the spiritual heart of the Animal resistance movement:

  • Ancient: Predates all other magical traditions in Oz
  • Natural: Flows from the land itself, not from books or institutions
  • Forbidden: Practicing Lurline magic openly is heresy in most of Oz
  • Communal: Often taught orally, practitioner to practitioner, in secret
  • Liberation: Many spells specifically help Animals and resist state oppression

Learning Lurline Magic

Lurline magic cannot be learned from books or institutions. It requires:

  • Direct teaching from an existing Lurlinite
  • Deep connection to natural Oz (spending months in wilderness)
  • Acceptance by nature spirits or fey creatures
  • Sometimes spontaneous awakening in times of great need (especially for Animals)

Many Animals have an instinctive connection to Lurline magic and can learn it more easily than humanoids.

GM Notes

Power and Persecution

Lurlinites walk a dangerous path in the Wizard's Oz:

  • Their magic is illegal in most regions
  • They're hunted by Unionist Inquisitors
  • They're heroes to the Animal resistance
  • Their spells directly counter Unionist control magic

Environmental Connection

Consider requiring:

  • Urban Penalty: Lurline spells might require higher-level spell slots in cities
  • Corrupted Land: Areas scarred by industrialization might block Lurline magic entirely
  • Sacred Sites: Ancient groves and Lurline shrines might grant bonus effects
  • The Green: Lurline magic is strongest in the Great Gillikin Forest and other wild places

Lurline Herself

Is Lurline a god, a fairy queen, or simply a mythologized magical force? Different Lurlinites have different beliefs. Unlike the Unnamed God, Lurline doesn't grant explicit divine intervention—her power flows more subtly through nature itself.

Related Pages

  • The Lurlinite - Primary class using this tradition
  • Lurline - The fairy queen who blessed Oz
  • Animals - Often instinctively connected to Lurline magic
  • Unionist Tradition - Rival divine tradition
  • The Witch - Some witches learn Lurline magic

magic/spells/witch-tradition.title: Witch Tradition Spells
magic/spells/witch-tradition.content:
Witch Tradition Spells

"Magic flows through my blood, written in my skin, whispered by shadows. I am born to this power—and it will be my salvation or my doom."

The Witch tradition is not one unified magical practice but rather a collection of diverse, often hereditary magical gifts. Unlike Adepts who study magic academically or Unionists who channel divine power, Witches are magic—it's in their blood, their bones, their very existence.

Witch magic encompasses three main sources: Blood (hereditary sorcery), Pact (bargains with otherworldly entities), and Learned (self-taught hedge magic). Each witch's relationship to their power is intensely personal and often complicated.

Tradition Characteristics

  • Source: Bloodline, pacts, hedge magic, innate power
  • Method: Instinct, willpower, ritual practice, personal symbols
  • Strength: Versatile, can access diverse spell types, powerful unique abilities
  • Limitation: Unpredictable, often carries social stigma, can corrupt the caster

Witch Magic Types

Witch spells come from different sources depending on the witch's Path:

  • Blood Witches - Hereditary magic, often green-skinned, connected to emotions and raw power
  • Pact Witches - Power granted by mysterious patrons (fey lords, demons, ancient spirits)
  • Learned Witches - Self-taught practitioners who master magic through study and experimentation (Kumbric Witch tradition)

Cantrips (0-Level)

Conj

  • Mage Hand - A spectral hand appears within 30 feet and can manipulate objects (up to 10 pounds), open doors, or retrieve items. Lasts 1 minute.

Divin

  • True Strike - You extend your hand toward one creature within 30 feet. On your next turn, you gain advantage on your first attack roll against it.

Ench

  • Friends - For 1 minute, you have advantage on Charisma checks against one creature. When the spell ends, the creature realizes it was magically influenced and becomes hostile.

Evoc

  • Eldritch Blast - A beam of crackling energy streaks toward a creature within 120 feet. Make a ranged spell attack dealing 1d10 force damage. Creates additional beams at higher levels (2 at 5th, 3 at 11th, 4 at 17th).
  • Ray of Frost - A frigid beam shoots toward a creature within 60 feet. Make a ranged spell attack dealing 1d8 cold damage and reducing its speed by 10 feet until the start of your next turn.

Illus

  • Minor Illusion - You create a sound or image within 30 feet that lasts 1 minute. The illusion is obviously magical to anyone who investigates it (Investigation vs. your spell save DC).

Necro

  • Chill Touch - You create a spectral skeletal hand that makes a ranged spell attack (120 feet), dealing 1d8 necrotic damage. Target can't regain hit points until the start of your next turn. Damage increases at higher levels.

1st-Circle Spells

Abjur

  • Shield - When you're hit by an attack, use your reaction to gain +5 AC until the start of your next turn, potentially causing the attack to miss.
  • Mage Armor - Touch a willing creature not wearing armor. Its AC becomes 13 + Dexterity modifier for 8 hours.

Conj

  • Witch Bolt - Make a ranged spell attack against a creature within 30 feet. On hit, it takes 1d12 lightning damage and a beam connects you. Each turn, you can use your action to automatically deal 1d12 damage. Lasts 1 minute or until your concentration breaks.

Divin

  • Detect Magic - For 10 minutes, you sense magic within 30 feet and can use your action to see a faint aura around magical objects or creatures and learn their school of magic.

Ench

  • Charm Person - One humanoid within 30 feet must make a Wisdom save or be charmed for 1 hour. The charmed creature regards you as a friendly acquaintance. The spell ends if you or your allies harm it.
  • Hex - Choose a creature within 90 feet. It has disadvantage on ability checks of one type (Strength, Dexterity, etc.) and takes an extra 1d6 necrotic damage when you hit it with an attack. Lasts 1 hour. If the target drops to 0 HP, you can move the hex to a new creature as a bonus action.

Evoc

  • Burning Hands - Fire shoots from your outstretched hands in a 15-foot cone. Creatures in the area make a Dexterity save, taking 3d6 fire damage on failure (half on success).

2nd-Circle Spells

Abjur

  • Misty Step - You teleport up to 30 feet to an unoccupied space you can see. Cast as a bonus action.

Divin

  • Detect Thoughts - For 1 minute, you can read the surface thoughts of creatures within 30 feet. You can also probe deeper (Wisdom save to resist), learning reasoning, emotional state, and something important to them.

Ench

  • Suggestion - One creature within 60 feet must make a Wisdom save or follow a reasonable course of action you describe (1-2 sentences). Lasts up to 8 hours or until completed.
  • Hold Person - Choose a humanoid within 60 feet. It must succeed on a Wisdom save or be paralyzed for 1 minute (can repeat save each turn).

Illus

  • Invisibility - A creature you touch becomes invisible for 1 hour or until it attacks or casts a spell.

3rd-Circle Spells

Conj

  • Fly - You touch a willing creature, granting it a flying speed of 60 feet for 10 minutes. When the spell ends, the target falls if still airborne.

Ench

  • Fear - Each creature in a 30-foot cone must succeed on a Wisdom save or drop what it's holding and become frightened for 1 minute. While frightened, it must take the Dash action to move away from you.

Evoc

  • Fireball - A bright streak flashes from your finger to a point within 150 feet and blossoms into a 20-foot radius explosion. Creatures in the area make a Dexterity save, taking 8d6 fire damage on failure (half on success).
  • Lightning Bolt - A stroke of lightning 100 feet long and 5 feet wide blasts from you. Creatures in the line make a Dexterity save, taking 8d6 lightning damage on failure (half on success).

Necro

  • Vampiric Touch - Touch a creature. Make a melee spell attack dealing 3d6 necrotic damage. You regain hit points equal to half the damage dealt. Lasts 1 minute (concentration); you can make the attack again each turn as an action.

4th-Circle Spells

Ench

  • Polymorph - Transform a creature within 60 feet into a beast with CR equal to or less than its level. It retains personality but uses the beast's statistics. Lasts 1 hour or until reduced to 0 HP.

Evoc

  • Ice Storm - Hail falls in a 20-foot radius, 40-foot high cylinder within 300 feet. Creatures in the area take 2d8 bludgeoning and 4d6 cold damage (Dexterity save for half). The area becomes difficult terrain until the end of your next turn.

5th-Circle Spells

Conj

  • Teleportation Circle - You create a 10-foot diameter circle linked to a permanent teleportation circle whose sigil sequence you know. The portal remains open until the end of your next turn.

Ench

  • Dominate Person - One humanoid within 60 feet must succeed on a Wisdom save or be charmed for 1 minute. You have a telepathic link and can command it. Repeats save when it takes damage.

Witch-Only Spells

These spells are unique to the Witch tradition and reflect the diverse, often dark nature of witch magic.

Broomflight (2nd Circle)

School: Transmutation
Casting Time: 1 action
Range: Touch
Components: V, S, M (a broom or staff)
Duration: 1 hour

You touch a broom, staff, or similar object and transform it into a flying vehicle. For the duration:

  • The item can carry up to 200 pounds
  • It has a flying speed of 60 feet and can hover
  • You control it with your mind while riding it
